meanings.definition: A narrow valley between hills or mountains, typically with steep rocky walls and a stream running through it.
meanings.sent1: The hikers explored the beautiful gorge with its rushing stream.
meanings.sent2: The river carved a deep gorge through the mountains over centuries.
meanings.sent3: The adventurous squirrel tried to cross the gorge on a fallen tree trunk.
meanings.sent4: The gorge looked like a giant scar on the face of the earth.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight barely reached the bottom of the gorge, creating a mysterious atmosphere.

meanings.definition: To eat a large amount greedily; fill oneself with food.
meanings.sent1: After the long hike, the hungry bear would gorge on berries and fish.
meanings.sent2: During the feast, the guests would gorge on delicious dishes.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon tried to gorge on all the picnic snacks.
meanings.sent4: She felt guilty after gorging on sweets at the party.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked bread made him gorge on the whole loaf.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to feel full to the point of discomfort.
meanings.sent1: The rich dessert would gorge the guests at the banquet.
meanings.sent2: The heavy meal would gorge him to the point of needing a nap.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly threatened to gorge her friend with popcorn at the movie.
meanings.sent4: The endless buffet would gorge even the most voracious eaters.
meanings.sent5: The holiday feast would gorge everyone until they could barely move.
